content: one per panel pg 25 www hodgepodge-crochet com now you have two finished panels front and back of the bag you will work the top edging and handle on each panel separately you will work 4 row of single_crochet across the top work 1 handle row then 3 more row of single_crochet then 1 row of loose slip stitches on top do the same thing for both panels don t worry about the exact number of stitches on the top just make sure you work into each stitch across and then first 10 stitches and last 10 stitches will still make sense top edging + handle for one panel attach your yarn at the top right corner of the panel with the outside facing you row 1 4 single_crochet edging 1 row 1 o chain 1 o single_crochet in each stitch across the top edge o turn 2 row 2 o chain 1 o single_crochet in each stitch across o turn 3 row 3 o chain 1 o single_crochet in each stitch across o turn 4 row 4 o chain 1 o single_crochet in each stitch across o turn you now have a neat 4-row single_crochet band at the top row 5 make the handle opening we re going to make 10 stitches on one side a long chain for the handle skip the middle stitches then work into the 10 stitches on the other side 1 chain 1 2 single_crochet in the first 10 stitches 3 chain 50 or more/less if you want a longer/shorter handle pg 26 www hodgepodge-crochet com 4 now look at the end of the row on the left side o count 10 stitches in from the left edge 5 insert your hook into that 10th stitch from the edge 6 single_crochet in that stitch 7 single_crochet in each stitch to the end of the row 8 turn you now have 10 single_crochet on the right a long chain loop in the middle the handle 10 single_crochet on the left all the stitches in the middle are skipped so the chain floats above them row 6 single_crochet into stitches and chain 1 chain 1 2 single_crochet in each stitch across until you reach the chain 3 single_crochet in each chain across the handle 1 single_crochet in each chain 4 after the last chain single_crochet in each remaining stitch to the end 5 turn now the chain strap is thicker and looks like part of the edging row 7 8 more single_crochet to thicken the top 1 row 7 o chain 1 o single_crochet in each stitch across including over the handle area o turn 2 row 8 o chain 1 o single_crochet in each stitch across again o turn the top band and handle are now thicker and stronger row 9 loose slip_stitch row this last row gives a nice finished edge 1 chain 1 2 work a loose slip_stitch in each stitch across the row o insert hook into the next stitch o yarn
